name: Sheraton Ann Arbor Hotel

reviews.text: Had a great stay. Comfy bed, good restaurant on site. Workout room was amazing. They had enough machines, Mats for floor work, and water Nd towels along with personal TVs on the machines as well as large ones for the whole room.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.text: Desk staff was OK but I didn't have any problems.
reviews.title: Front desk is brutal, but the rooms are ok.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'll stay here again if I can!
reviews.title: Short drive to Ann Arbor, nice hotel

reviews.text: This is not your typical Sheraton hotel.
reviews.title: Very good hotel and could be great!

reviews.text: The rooms are alright, but it is certainly not up to par at the front desk. The staff couldn't find our reservation, could find our loyalty number, didn't tell us anything about the facilities and then, to top if off, they gave our room to someone else in the middle of our stay! The front desk actually called us on the second morning of our stay to ask us who we were.
reviews.title: Great rooms, great staff, great property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at both the Fairfield and Courtyard hotels across the street and this one surpassed both of those. The furnishings are modern and crisp. The room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. Our only issues were: 1) the glass shade covers for the lights over the registration desk had some dead bugs (not many). I pointed it out to the registration person and he seemed genuinely embarassed. 2) they had problems with their Internet service which was fixed sometime during the night. Definitely get the AAA deal that includes either the buffet or plated American breakfast. Well worth the extra few dollars.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.text: We stayed for pleasure on the weekend of Aug 4. They put us on the top floor for the club lounge level. The room was very nice. Just alittle tight. I'm use to staying in suites. Pool was nice with the indoor/ outdoor joined. Nice and quiet on top floor, so good night sleep.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel rooms abit tight

reviews.text: We stayed here for a week in August. Family of 4 in 1 room. Rooms were nicely appointed and roomy. There was a fridge and a microwave in the room. It is about a 5-10 min drive to the university of michigan and the downtown area. Breakfast was adequate with a buffet for $14 and $5 for children. Price for us was $135/night plus tax which was adequate for the room. I would recommend for a nice comfortable stay but must have a car to get around. Swimming pool and hot tub were nice and warm and is indoor/outdoor. Lobby was attractive and the hotel seemed updated and nicely appointed.
reviews.title: Clean and well appointed Sheraton.

reviews.text: This is now probably the fourth stay at the Sheraton. Again, they exceeded expectations in their service, amenities and overall quality of the stay. We were able to try the onsite restaurant both at breakfast and via room service. I was impressed by the attention they place on their food service...not simply checking a box for a hot breakfast or room service. The selection at breakfast was outstanding and the quality of the buffet and the omelette service was a nice touch.
reviews.title: Another Terrific Experience

reviews.text: The dinner menu was better than usual hotel fare. They also have a closed air wine by the glass with an above average wine selection.
reviews.title: My favourite place to stay in Ann Arbor!

reviews.text: The bed here was so comfortable. The facility has gone over a major update recently and looks great. Rooms were nice and clean.
reviews.title: Best night of sleep

reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone interested in a good night of sleep
reviews.title: Very nice!

reviews.text: Went to Sheraton, Ann Arbor for a wedding for the weekend of Sept. 21st to Sept. 23rd.
reviews.title: Two More Perfect Stays!

reviews.text: Staff were exceptionally friendly, and excellent customer service.
reviews.title: no issues

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were fairly big, hotel was clean, the only amenity I used was the pool. The pool was clean and temperature was perfect as it was quite chilly outside. The hot tub didn't work, as I couldn't get the jets to work, maybe I didn't know how, but it didn't work, so I was a bit disappointed.
reviews.title: Expected more from this hotel...

reviews.text: We enjoyed the Four Points experience although the hotel did need an upgrade. How has it changed since becoming a full blown Sheraton property? Well, a positive development is that it partners with Starbucks. The welcome desk is now more personal although the personnel are less friendly (probably due to a change in the general manager). The lobby area is more open allowing for a far greater level of noise from the bar and surroundings, especially when there is a catered event or a UMich game. The 6th floor lounge food is way upgraded but its architecture is inconvenient with a long table (to share with strangers) dominating and a lack of individual or small group seating. Also, the coffee is hidden in a corner so a person preparing a cup blocks access to other food and drink. Food runs short and refills are long in coming. Patronage is not upgraded - a man ate breakfast in the lounge barefooted and in pajamas. Look - it is fine to stay here and earn SPG points, and we will surely return. I am just not sure it is an advantage over Four Points or, for that matter, the less costly Hampton Inn properties in town.
reviews.title: Four Points or Sheraton - What's The Diff?

reviews.text: This hotel can be had for really great rates if one chooses to the prepaid rate, please note this is not refundable and there are no cancellations when choosing the prepaid rate.
reviews.title: Great hotel and great rate in Ann Arbor

reviews.text: Rooms are clean and hotel has a great bar and also restaurant with good food.
reviews.title: Quiet stay in beautiful Ann Arbor

reviews.text: Housecleaning was rather unfriendly otherwise everyone else there was very customer service oriented.
reviews.title: Good Business Hotel

reviews.text: I had a nice overnight stay at the Sheraton Ann Arbor. Here are my thoughts:
reviews.title: Great choice!

description: Welcome! The Sheraton Ann Arbor invites you to experience unparalleled service and accommodations while exploring Ann Arbor, Michigan.
